Race.SpecificTitle: Parishwide -- 5 Mill Cons. FPD - PJ - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
PARISHWIDE PROPOSITION
(PROPERTY TAX)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR CONSOLIDATED FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT OF THE PARISH OF ASSUMPTION, TO LEVY A 10-YEAR 5-MILLS PROPERTY TAX FOR ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING, IMPROVING, MAINTAINING AND/OR OPERATING FIRE PROTECTION AND EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICE FACILITIES, FOR PURCHASING FIRE TRUCKS AND OTHER FIRE FIGHTING OR EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICE EQUIPMENT IN AND FOR THE DISTRICT, AND PAYMENT OF ALL RELATED PERSONNEL COSTS, AND PAYING THE COST OF OBTAINING WATER FOR FIRE PROTECTION PURPOSES, INCLUDING CHARGES FOR FIRE HYDRANT RENTALS AND SERVICE, PROVIDED NEITHER OF THE MILLAGES CURRENTLY AUTHORIZED IN FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 1 AND FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 2 OF SAID PARISH ARE LEVIED.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated Fire Protection District of the Parish of Assumption, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of five (5) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2016, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection and emergency medical service facilities, for purchasing fire trucks and other fire fighting or emergency medical service equipment in and for the district, and payment of all related personnel costs, and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, provided neither of the millages currently authorized in Fire Protection District No. 1 and Fire Protection District No. 2 of said Parish are levied?

Race.SummaryText:
SCHOOL DISTRICT NO. 1 PROPOSITION
(MILLAGE RENEWAL)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY TO CONTINUE TO LEVY A 20.81 MILLS TAX FOR 10 YEARS FOR THE PURPOSE OF GIVING ADDITIONAL AID AND SUPPORT TO THE PUBLIC SCHOOLS OF SCHOOL DISTRICT NO. 1.
Race.FullText: Shall School District No. 1 of the Parish of Assumption, State of Louisiana (the "District") continue to levy a special tax of twenty and eighty-one hundredths (20.81) mills on all property subject to taxation within said District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, for the purpose of giving additional aid and support to the public schools of the said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting Dist. No. 1 -- 20 Mill - PJ - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
ROAD LIGHTING DISTRICT NO. 1 PROPOSITION
(RENEWAL TAX)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY TO CONTINUE TO LEVY A 20 MILLS TAX FOR 10 YEARS BEGINNING WITH THE YEAR 2007 FOR THE PURPOSE OF MAINTAINING, IMPROVING AND KEEPING IN REPAIR, THE SYSTEM OF THE ROAD LIGHTING IN SAID DISTRICT.
Race.FullText: Shall Assumption Parish Road Lighting District No. 1 continue to levy a tax of not exceeding twenty (20) mills on all property subject to taxation in said District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2016, for the purpose of maintaining, improving and keeping in repair, the system of the road lighting in said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Bayou L'Ourse GDD No. 1 -- $50 Parcel Fee - BOC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
BAYOU L'OURSE GRAVITY DRAINAGE DISTRICT NO. 1 PROPOSITION
(PARCEL FEE RENEWAL)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY TO CONTINUE TO LEVY A $50 PARCEL FEE FOR 15 YEARS FOR THE PURPOSE OF PAYING THE COST OF CONSTRUCTING AND MAINTAINING LEVEES, LEVEE DRAINAGE, FLOOD PROTECTION, HURRICANE FLOOD PROTECTION, AND ALL PURPOSES INCIDENTAL THERETO, INCLUDING PAYING COMPENSATION FOR THE EXERCISE OF PERMANENT OR TEMPORARY SERVITUDES, AND TO PAY, IN WHOLE OR IN PART, THE PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON BONDS OF SAID DISTRICT.
Race.FullText: Shall the Bayou L'Ourse Gravity Drainage District No. 1 of the Parish of Assumption, Louisiana, continue to levy and collect an annual parcel fee of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) on each lot, sub-divided portion of ground and/or individual tract located in said District for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2021, in the manner  set out in Section 2740.16 of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, for the purpose of paying the cost of constructing and maintaining levees, levee drainage, flood protection, hurricane flood protection, and all purposes incidental thereto, including paying compensation for the exercise of permanent or temporary servitudes, and to pay, in whole or in part, the payment of principal and interest on bonds of said District for any of the capital purposes set forth above, including any necessary reserve therefor and paying the costs of issuing such bonds?

Race.SpecificTitle: Landry Subdiv. GDD. No. 7 -- $50 Parcel Fee - BOC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
LANDRY SUBDIVISION GRAVITY DRAINAGE DISTRICT #7 PROPOSITION
(PARCEL FEE RENEWAL)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY TO CONTINUE TO LEVY A $50 PARCEL FEE FOR 15 YEARS FOR THE PURPOSE OF PAYING THE COST OF CONSTRUCTING AND MAINTAINING LEVEES, LEVEE DRAINAGE, FLOOD PROTECTION, HURRICANE FLOOD PROTECTION, AND ALL PURPOSES INCIDENTAL THERETO, INCLUDING PAYING COMPENSATION FOR THE EXERCISE OF PERMANENT OR TEMPORARY SERVITUDES, AND TO PAY, IN WHOLE OR IN PART, THE PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON BONDS OF SAID DISTRICT.
Race.FullText: Shall the Landry Subdivision Gravity Drainage District #7 of the Parish of Assumption, Louisiana, continue to levy and collect an annual parcel fee of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) on each lot, sub-divided portion of ground and/or individual tract located in said District for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2021, in the manner set out in Section 2740.16 of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, for the purpose of paying the cost of constructing and maintaining levees, levee drainage, flood protection, hurricane flood protection, and all purposes incidental thereto, including paying compensation for the exercise of permanent or temporary servitudes, and to pay, in whole or in part, the payment of principal and interest on bonds of said District for any of the capital purposes set forth above, including any necessary reserve therefor and paying the costs of issuing such bonds?
